normalizedLabel.description: Domain label in lowercase for case-insensitive uniqueness validation. e.g. 'bob'
normalizedLabel.$comment: Must be equal to the label in lowercase. This property will be deprecated due to case insensitive indices

normalizedParentDomainName.description: A full parent domain name in lowercase for case-insensitive uniqueness validation. e.g. 'dash'
normalizedParentDomainName.$comment: Must either be equal to an existing domain or empty to create a top level domain. Only the data contract owner can create top level domains.

preorderSalt.description: Salt used in the preorder document

dashUniqueIdentityId.description: Identity ID to be used to create the primary name the Identity
dashUniqueIdentityId.$comment: Must be equal to the document owner

dashAliasIdentityId.description: Identity ID to be used to create alias names for the Identity
dashAliasIdentityId.$comment: Must be equal to the document owner

records.$comment: Constraint with max and min properties ensure that only one identity record is used - either a `dashUniqueIdentityId` or a `dashAliasIdentityId`

allowSubdomains.description: This option defines who can create subdomains: true - anyone; false - only the domain owner
allowSubdomains.$comment: Only the domain owner is allowed to create subdomains for non top-level domains

subdomainRules.description: Subdomain rules allow domain owners to define rules for subdomains

domain.$comment: In order to register a domain you need to create a preorder. The preorder step is needed to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks. normalizedLabel + '.' + normalizedParentDomain must not be longer than 253 chars length as defined by RFC 1035. Domain documents are immutable: modification and deletion are restricted

saltedDomainHash.description: Double sha-256 of the concatenation of a 32 byte random salt and a normalized domain name

preorder.$comment: Preorder documents are immutable: modification and deletion are restricted
